metadata.title: CVE-2021-29955 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A transient execution vulnerability, named Floating Point Value Injection(FPVI) allowed an attacker to leak arbitrary memory addresses and may havealso enabled JIT type confusion attacks. (A related vulnerability,Speculative Code Store Bypass (SCSB), did not affect Firefox.). Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9 and Firefox < 87.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
